item.title: A Canter through Statistics
item.description: The model $$y_i = \beta_0 + \beta _1 x_i + \epsilon _i, i = 1 \ldots n$$ where $\epsilon _i$ are the random error components. Following assumptions are made: $\mathbb{E} (\epsilon _i) = 0, i = 1 \ldots n$ $\mathit{Var} (\epsilon _i) = \sigma ^2, i = 1 \ldots n$ $\mathit{Cov} (\epsilon _i, \epsilon _j) = 0, i = 1 \ldots n$
item.content:
The model $$y_i = \beta_0 + \beta _1 x_i + \epsilon _i, i = 1 \ldots n$$ where $\epsilon _i$ are the random error components. Following assumptions are made:

  1. $\mathbb{E} (\epsilon _i) = 0, i = 1 \ldots n$
  2. $\mathit{Var} (\epsilon _i) = \sigma ^2, i = 1 \ldots n$
  3. $\mathit{Cov} (\epsilon _i, \epsilon _j) = 0, i = 1 \ldots n$

item.title: A Start
item.description: Welcome, off to a good start. $$results = f(hard work, luck)$$
item.content: Welcome, off to a good start. $$results = f(hard work, luck)$$
